results.title: More Winners : Mr. Edmund (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Anthony Buckley and George Whaley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners”.
12 year old Cheryl Williams befriends Mr. Edmund, who is one of the rather impoverished guests at her mother’s boarding house. Mr. Edmund has a dream that one day he will sing at the Sydney Opera House. Cherry has a dream too, that one day she will be a lawyer. Cherry’s mother believes these are foolish dreams and urges the two of them to “grow up”. Mr. Edmund, Cherry and her younger brother Sam save old Mrs. Finkel from a bag snatcher. She is grateful and when she hears of Mr. Edmund’s dream. Mrs. Finkel insists on hiring the Opera House Concert Hall for him for one night.

results.title: More Winners : Mr Edmund
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Australian Children's Television Foundation and George Whaley
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
Twelve year old Cherry Williams befriends Mr Edmund, who is one of the rather impoverished guests at her mother’s boarding house. Mr Edmund has a dream that one day she will be a lawyer. Cherry’s mother believes these are foolish dreams and urges the two of them to grow up. Mr Edmund, Cherry and her younger brother, Sam, save old Mrs Finkel from a bag snatcher. She is grateful and when she hears of Mr Edmund’s dream insists on hiring the Opera House Concert Hall for him for one night. They are all to participate in the concert. On the big day Mr Edmund, Cherry and Sam learn that Mrs Finkel is dying in hospital and that she did not really have the money to hire the Concert hall. Cherry thinks that her mother has been right all along: dreams are for kids. Mr Edmund, however, is determined to have his moment on the Concert Hall stage partly in memory of Mrs Finkel but also as a celebration of hope. Rated: G

results.title: More Winners : His Master's Ghost
results.creator_credit: Margaret McDonald, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
A vacation music camp at an old country estate brings together a group of children, not all of whom have come with music foremost in their minds. The estate has an air of mystery about it and when mention is made of a live-in ghost, some of the children, especially Flea, become fascinated. Flea’s obsession in tracking down the ghost and playing practical jokes leads him into constant trouble with the teachers. Meanwhile, Jason, a rather serious boy is, against some purist opposition, trying to get his Concerto for the Rock Group and Orchestra, which has a very difficult solo passage, played in the final concert. Between these two stories floats the estate’s caretaker, a figure of mystery and fascination. Rated: G

results.title: More Winners : His master's ghost (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Margot McDonald and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
A group of children are brought together to holiday at a music camp. set at an old estate, rumoured to have its own live-in ghost. One of the children, Flea, becomes obsessed with tracking down the phantom. Meanwhile Jason is attempting to get his Concerto for Rock Group and Orchestra approved of. During all this, strange things begin to happen whenever the estate’s mysterious care-taker is around.

results.title: More Winners: Boy Soldiers
results.creator_credit: Quartier Latin International, Australian Children's Television Foundation, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Margot McDonald, Mark Joffe and Cliff Green
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘More Winners’.
In 1910 the Australian Government passed a law requiring all boys aged between 14 and 17 years of age to register for compulsory military training. Between 1911 and 1915, more than 30,000 boys were persecuted for failing to obey this law. This story tells of one such boy, Will Barnes, a 14 year old conscientious objector who refuses to register. After prosecution Will is sentenced to three months training at Fort Queenscliff. At the fort, Will refuses to wear a uniform or to be involved in any type of military training. Will meets a lot of opposition but also wins his share of admirers, for sticking to his beliefs.

Cast includes Tamblyn Lord, Nathan Croft, Bruno Lawrence, Nicholas Bell and Gary Sweet.

results.title: Winners [Series]
results.brief_description: ‘Winners’ and ‘More Winners’ are anthology series of fourteen telemovies, featuring historical drama, comedy, science fiction, fantasy, adventure and social realism. Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.

results.title: Winners: The Paper Boy
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Ballantyne, Bob Ellis and Paul Cox
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.

Cast includes Christopher Schlusser, Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Linden Wilkinson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Ballantyne, Bob Ellis and Paul Cox

results.title: Winners: The Other Facts of Life
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Sandra Levy, Julia Overton, Esben Storm and Morris Gleitzman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Ben can’t understand how people can live so happily with the injustice and disaster going on in the world. His family’s lack of response leads Ben to mount a one person awareness crusade. Nothing seems to distract Ben from the larger troubles of the world until a crisis causes him to focus his energies on loving and helping his family.

Cast includes Dennis Miller, Anne Grigg, and Ken Talbot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Sandra Levy, Julia Overton, Esben Storm and Morris Gleitzman

results.title: Winners: On Loan
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Scott, Geoffrey Bennett and Anne Brooksbank
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
At her 14th birthday party Lindy wishes she knew her actual birth date. But only her real parents would know, and they’re both dead. Or so Lindy and her Australian family think until a letter from her natural father arrives. Now she must decide between two families and two futures, between Australia and Vietnam.

Cast includes Marillac Johnston, John Walton and Belinda Giblin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, ITC Entertainment, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, New South Wales Film Corporation, Jane Scott, Geoffrey Bennett and Anne Brooksbank
